passage: A model created by biologist Luis Valente predicts that the rate of speciation—the rate at which new species form—on an isolated island located approximately 5,000 kilometers from the nearest mainland ______ blank triple the rate of speciation on an island only 500 kilometers from the mainland.
question_text: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

answer_rationales.D: Choice D is the best answer. The convention being tested is finite and nonfinite verb forms within a sentence. Relative clauses, such as the one beginning with "that," require a finite verb, a verb that can function as the main verb of a clause. This choice correctly supplies the clause with the finite future tense verb "will be."
answer_rationales.A: Choice A is incorrect because the nonfinite participle "being" doesn't supply the clause with a finite verb.
answer_rationales.B: Choice B is incorrect because the nonfinite to-infinitive "to be" doesn't supply the clause with a finite verb.
answer_rationales.C: Choice C is incorrect because the nonfinite to-infinitive "to have been" doesn't supply the clause with a finite verb.
